H2165.def: = specific moment in time that has been decided for a certain event to take place

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H2656.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H5193.def: = action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H6555.def: = process by which a container bursts open due to abundance of contents

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H5594.def: = action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H7540.def: = action with which humans or animals move in a quick and light or lively way

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H3664.def: causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or objects to come together in one location

H2263.def: = action by which humans put their arms around someone else ► as a greeting, a sign of affection, or during love-making

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H7167.def: = causative action by which humans or animals rip apart the human body or an inanimate object, either in part of entirely; usually with their hands

H8609.def: = to join together pieces of cloth or animal skin with stitches using a needle and thread from local plants ... for making clothing or shelter

H2814.def: = action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3504.def: = something that is of benefit to humans; often used in rhetorical questions suggesting that nothing is of benefit at all in a certain situation

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
